quest.name: Never Be Royal
journal:
 Quest Sync
Sezul appears desperate to have Tataramu back at work on the Dezul Qualan.

Desperate to have Tataramu back at work on the Dezul Qualan, Sezul has asked that you approach a member of Highwind Skyways directly. Head to the airship landing in Gridania, and find a Skyways employee who might know of Tataramu's present whereabouts.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.

Despite being summarily dismissed by Chairman Tatabaru's private clerk, you learn that she will soon join the head of Highwind Skyways on a journey to the Observatorium. Make your own way to the Coerthas central highlands, and question the private clerk once more.
You manage to pressure the private clerk into revealing that the chairman's son has accompanied them to Coerthas. Search the residences of the Observatorium and find Tataramu.

Though you have found Tataramu, it appears that his movements are being monitored by the wine-swilling retainers in the next room. The young man suggests that you consult Templeton, and contrive a method by which Tataramu can escape without risking undue notice. Speak with the Skywinds employee in the Observatorium's crafting facility.

You speak with Templeton, and the devious craftsman suggests the use of a potent sleeping potion mixed into a half-empty bottle of wine. Take the bottle and surreptitiously place it on the table in the room where the mercenary guards are drinking.

Completely oblivious to your sleight of hand, the retainers begin quaffing the contents of the seemingly innocuous wine bottle. Enter the adjoining chamber and report the progress of the escape plan to Tataramu.

You report the success of Templeton's plan to an astonished Tataramu. Well aware of his guards' proclivity for drinking, the airship designer deems the sellswords sufficiently insensate to risk a swift dash through the door. Head outside and rendezvous with Tataramu.

Just as it seems that Tataramu has made good his escape, you are startled by the sudden appearance of Advisor Colson. Though the aged technician is initially disapproving of Tataramu's actions, he is eventually swayed by the young man's impassioned plea that he be allowed to follow his dreams. Return to Ehcatl and rejoin Sezul.

Sezul is overcome with emotion at Tataramu's return. No sooner has the chief mastered his tears and ordered the designer back to work, however, than the Ixali chieftain of the nearby logging ground makes an unexpected and unwelcome visit. Cawing with triumph at his discovery of the hidden camp, the exultant chieftain promises an unpleasant fate for the Ehcatl Nine. Sezul and his crew must now race to complete the Dezul Qualan before the Natalan Ixal arrive to destroy all that they have worked to accomplish...
objectives: Search for a Highwind Skyways clerk at the Gridania airship landing.
Speak with the private clerk at the Observatorium.
Place the half-empty wine bottle on the sellswords' table.
Speak with Sezul Totoloc at Ehcatl.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk... Greetings, Forename. Mood of the camp, dampened, it is. Dark and dreary.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Lie dormant, Dezul Qualan does... Like deflated balloon. Fly without Tataramu's touch, it cannot.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Rely on Tataramu, we did. More than Sezul realized. Become heart of Ehcatl Nine, Tataramu has!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Despise this helpless feeling, Sezul does! Ask Forename to visit Gridania and parley with Highwind Skyways, Sezul would! Squawk!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Only fledglings sit and screech and do nothing! Tataramu needs to fly, and give him that chance, we will!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Caw, caw, caw! So serious, Sezul has become... Bring small featherless one back to us, Forename must...

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Go to place of airships in Gridania and speak with company member. Find where Tataramu has been caged, Forename must...

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, were you addressing me? If you've a business proposal or seek employment, then I must ask that you first make an appointment through the official company represen─

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: Hm? You wish to know Tataramu's whereabouts? ...I assume you are referring to Master Tataramu?

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but I must inquire as to your relationship with the chairman's son. I fail to see how someone of your apparent─

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: ...Argh! It's you! You were there in that filthy Ixali camp!

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: You're the one who conspired with those betaloned savages to kidnap Master Tataramu! Well, I'm certainly not about to share any information with a disreputable ruffian such as you! Shoo! Begone!

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: <groan> ...Now I shall be late in boarding the chairman's flight to Coerthas! He has a very important meeting at the Observatorium with very important people!

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: You again! How ever did you know where to─ Ah. Well, I'll not stumble like that a second time!

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: Now, keep quiet! Chairman Tatabaru is engaged in extremely delicate negotiations and is not to be disturbed! ...Hm? You're still asking after Master Tataramu?

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: Ugh. Will you not be silent? If you absolutely must know, the young man accompanied us here as part of his continuing education in company management. His chambers are guarded by our loyal─not to mention lethal─retainers, so you can forget any plans to spirit him away again!

dialogue.name: HIGHEINDSECRETARY
dialogue.text: Do NOT disturb the chairman! He is in the middle of a very sensitive and highly confidential parley that could decide a future airship route to Ishgard! The fortune of the company may very well rest upon its outcome!

dialogue.name: TATABARU
dialogue.text: The role of the Observatorium in maintaining a Coerthas airship route cannot be underestimated.

dialogue.name: TATABARU
dialogue.text: As such, I would value any opinions or concerns House Durendaire might have with regards to the establishment of such a route.

dialogue.name: PORTELAINE
dialogue.text: I must say, your proposal is intriguing. As you have rightly ascertained, the very nature of the Observatorium places us in a unique position to oversee your company's endeavor.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Oh! Forename! What are you doing here!?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Sezul sent you...? Broken without me, you say? ...I never imagined that the absence of my skills would be so keenly felt!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I am flattered, but...as dearly as I would love to stroll out the door with you, I'm afraid things aren't that simple.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: My father dragged me along on the pretense that I would be “learning the trade,” then confined me to this room. I'm practically a prisoner!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Did you see the guards on your way in? Should I attempt to take even one step across the threshold, those company-bought thugs will stop me in my tracks.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Hmmm. There must be a way past them that doesn't involve outright violence...

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: ...I have it! You must needs speak with Templeton, the Skywinds employee stationed here at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: He's aided us with component crafting before, and is one of the few people in the company I might consider an ally. Wily he may be, but it is that exact trait that will serve us now!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I must escape this room without creating too much of a commotion. Speak with Templeton at the Observatorium's crafting facility─we have need of his crafty mind.

dialogue.name: TEMPLETON
dialogue.text: Ah, good day to you, adventurer! What may poor Templeton do to serve you on this cold and miserable day? Which, come to think of it, fairly well describes every day on this godsforsaken, croc-infested stretch of icy hell. ...Hm? Looking to break Master Tataramu from his confinement, are you?

dialogue.name: TEMPLETON
dialogue.text: Well now, I'm sure I couldn't possibly lend my assistance to such a shady undertaking! And I certainly wouldn't suggest the use of a particularly potent sleeping potion! <wink> <wink>

dialogue.name: TEMPLETON
dialogue.text: Our sellswords have grown fond of drinking mulled wine in an effort to forget their freezing extremities, and I'm sure they wouldn't question the appearance of another bottle on the table. 'Twould hardly be your fault if they overindulged and found themselves snoring under the table till morning!

dialogue.name: TEMPLETON
dialogue.text: Ahem! Away with you and your nefarious schemes! ...And be sure to pass on my regards to the chairman's son!

dialogue.name: TEMPLETON
dialogue.text: Loyal and steadfast, that's old Templeton for you! Surely Master Tataramu wouldn't wish to leave such a valuable servant to wither and shrink in this snow-choked wasteland forever!?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Forename! What news!? Was Templeton able to offer a solution to our dilemma? ...He gave you what!? A sleeping potion!?

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Well, I hope his concoction has no lasting ill effects... If past experience is aught to go by, those retainers should be well into their cups by now. I'll sneak past as quickly as I dare and meet you outside!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: So far, so good, it would seem! Now, let's return to Sezul's camp before my father concludes his negotiations!

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: A word with you, Master Tataramu.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Colson! Wh-When did you arrive in Coerthas? I-It is good to see you!

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I know what you're planning, lad, and you know what will happen should you go through with it. Your father will not tolerate this defiance!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: You've taken his side? I had thought that you, at least, would support me in this...

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Pray take a moment to consider your father's perspective: he only wants what is best for the future chairman of Highwind Skyways. The world you stand to inherit is not the world in which the rest of us live.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: There are commoners...and there are kings. We are all born into our fates and the responsibilities they bring.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I am no prince! I am but the privileged brat of an airship empire!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: And how did that empire come into being!? Highwind Skyways merely copied the balloons of the Ixal, and hopped a little into the air!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: I care not for our company's reputation or its profits! Fortune? Prestige? Its aims are so low!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Sezul and his Ehcatl Nine are reaching for the heavens! They have grand dreams, and a passion unlike any I've seen before!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: They seek to restore their lost wings, and, godsdammit, I would help them! I would share in that vision, soar in that same sky! That is all I wish for...

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: ...Go, Master Tataramu.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I will speak with the chairman myself. I will convince him of the depth of your desire...as you have convinced me.

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Y-You will...!?

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: I have underestimated you, young sir. Those eyes...that mask of determination... It is like witnessing a decades-old memory come to life.

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: There can be no doubt that your grandfather's blood runs hotly in your veins...

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Colson...

dialogue.name: COLSON
dialogue.text: Quickly now─off with you! The longer I stand here in the biting cold, the more my hip starts to ache. Oh, for the fervent heat of youth! Heh heh heh...

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Come, Forename. We have kept Sezul waiting long enough!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Chief Totoloc! Your designer has returned!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: ...Sezul?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Fogged up for no reason, goggles did! Not tears of joy, no! Humidity!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Listen well, Tataramu! Make up for lost time, we must! Work and work until Dezul Qualan is complete! Until hands ache and sweat turns to blood!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: Yes, sir!

dialogue.name: IXALBOSS01488
dialogue.text: (-???-)Found you! Found camp, we have! Reeking pile of dung hidden in forest!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: No! Not now...

dialogue.name: IXALBOSS
dialogue.text: (-Ixali Chieftain-)Knew you were sneaking about, we did. But know why, we did not until now!

dialogue.name: IXALBOSS
dialogue.text: (-Ixali Chieftain-)Preening feathers for forest people... Making unsanctioned balloon! Crime against goddess and our people, you have committed! Harsh, your punishment will be!

dialogue.name: IXAL01492
dialogue.text: (-Ixali Wings-)Break it all! Burn it down!

dialogue.name: IXALBOSS
dialogue.text: (-Ixali Chieftain-)Leave you to stew in fear, we shall! Hear of this treachery, our Natalan brothers will! Squawk!

dialogue.name: IXAL01492
dialogue.text: (-Ixali Wings-)Pluck their feathers! Snap their bones!

dialogue.name: TATARAMU
dialogue.text: S-Sezul!? What do we do!?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Found us, they have... Sezul knew this day would come...

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk! Too soon! Too soon, it is! If but complete Dezul Qualan, we can...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thanks to your diligent efforts, the construction of the Dezul Qualan is almost complete. With the return of Tataramu, a few final adjustments are now all that stand between the Ehcatl Nine and the distant skies...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Honored reputation with the Ehcatl Nine.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New Ixal tribal daily quests are now available from Jezul Ahuatan the Second at Ehcatl.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）
